FuncDef:
The ppp-user-slot-warning-threshold command sets an alarm threshold for PPP users allowed to access an interface board. If the percentage of PPP users currently accessing the interface board reaches the threshold, an alarm is generated.
The undo ppp-user-slot-warning-threshold command removes the alarm threshold set for PPP users allowed to access an interface board.
By default, the alarm threshold for PPP users allowed to access an interface board is 100.

ParaDef.Info:
Alarm threshold.
If the alarm threshold is set to 10, it indicates that if the percentage of the number of PPP users currently accessing an interface board to the maximum number of users allowed to access the interface board reaches 10%, an alarm is generated.
The value is in percentage, ranging from 1 to 100.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you run this command, if the percentage of the number of PPP users currently accessing an interface board to the maximum number of users allowed to access the interface board reaches the set threshold, an alarm is generated.
A dual-stack user will be counted as both an IPv6 user and an IPv4 user.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
